nodes.bodyText:
We should change import to require a space after it.
Why do coms need to end with .* but the others don't?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@
     <module name="RegexpSingleline">
       <!-- catch lines above 100 symbols -->
       <property name="format"
-                value="^(?!(.*href|.*http|import|.* com.*|.*com/.*|.* files=)).{101,}$"/>
+                value="^(?!(.*href|.*http|import|.* com\..*|.*com\..*|.* files=|.*\.dtd)).{101,}$"/>

nodes.bodyText: I upated regexp to make it more strict.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@
     <module name="RegexpSingleline">
       <!-- catch lines above 100 symbols -->
       <property name="format"
-                value="^(?!(.*href|.*http|import|.* com.*|.*com/.*|.* files=)).{101,}$"/>
+                value="^(?!(.*href|.*http|import|.* com\..*|.*com\..*|.* files=|.*\.dtd)).{101,}$"/>

nodes.bodyText: What is the original purpose of adding the com ones? From what I saw, it was for the XML files and their lines with multiple packages. Does it make sense we change the .* before them to something that will more specifically target the XML files instead of hitting our inputs by accident?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@

       <!-- catch lines above 100 symbols -->

+                value="^(?!(.*href|.*http|import|.* com\..*|.*com\..*|.* files=|.*\.dtd)).{101,}$"/>

nodes.bodyText:
fully qualified names.
We need to change this to wrap lines, most Inputs do not need this, it is just leftover. I created separate issue on this, to speedup validation enforcement ASAP.
